info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 10 at 12:18AM EST until further notice by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Mecklenburg County in piedmont North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 800 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1213 AM EST, High water conditions from the recent heavy rainfall continue along drainage basins in the southern end of Mecklenburg County, and minor flooding will continue in these areas overnight. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... South Charlotte, Matthews, and Pineville. - Flooding is most likely along McAlpine Creek at Colony Road. Flooding may impact Weirton Place and Colony Road. Additional flooding along McAlpine Creek may impact Sardis Road. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
